intro: Dryandra aurantia, commonly known as the golden dryandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with narrow, leathery leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are borne in dense, cylindrical spikes and are particularly showy during the spring and summer months. Dryandra aurantia is well adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands.
